snippet: The European Court of Human Rights said there should be a review of the three men's sentences, with the possibility that they could be freed.
abstract: European Court of Human Rights in Strasbourg, France, rules 16 to 1 that life sentences Great Britain handed to three convicted murderers amount to inhuman and degrading treatment because they have no hope of release; ruling deals blow to Britain and is one of several that have annoyed its dominant Conservative Party.
lead_paragraph: The European Court of Human Rights said there should be a review of the three men's sentences, with the possibility that they could be freed.
